questions.question: What is artificial intelligence (AI)?

options.a: A system that mimics human intelligence to perform tasks
options.b: A type of machine learning
options.d: A type of deep learning

questions.question: What is machine learning (ML)?

options.a: A subset of artificial intelligence that allows systems to learn from data
options.b: A method for collecting data from the internet
options.d: A system that mimics human intelligence

questions.question: What is the difference between AI and machine learning?

options.a: AI is broader and includes machine learning
options.b: AI and machine learning are the same
options.c: Machine learning is broader than AI
options.d: Machine learning is a type of AI, while AI also includes rule-based systems

questions.question: What is supervised learning?

options.a: A type of machine learning where the model is trained on labeled data
options.b: A method of machine learning where no labeled data is used
options.c: A machine learning technique for clustering
options.d: A technique for neural network optimization

questions.question: What is unsupervised learning?

options.a: A type of machine learning where the model works with unlabeled data
options.b: A method of machine learning that uses labeled data
options.c: A method for predicting future outcomes
options.d: A technique for solving classification problems

questions.question: What is a dataset in machine learning?

options.a: A collection of data used to train and test models
options.b: A model used for classification
options.d: A specific algorithm for data cleaning

questions.question: What is the purpose of a training set and a test set in machine learning?

options.a: Training set is used to train the model, and test set is used to evaluate its performance
options.b: Training set is used to evaluate the model, and test set is used for optimization
options.c: Training set is used for data cleaning, and test set is used for feature selection
options.d: Both training and test sets are used for the same purpose

questions.question: What is a feature in a dataset?

options.a: An individual measurable property or characteristic of the dataset
options.b: A type of machine learning algorithm
options.c: A subset of the training data
options.d: A model used for predictions

questions.question: What is a label in supervised learning?

options.a: The output variable or target value to predict
options.b: A feature used to describe the dataset
options.c: The process of training the model
options.d: The method of clustering the data

questions.question: What is overfitting in machine learning?

options.a: When a model learns too much from the training data and performs poorly on new data
options.b: When a model underperforms due to a lack of training
options.c: When a model ignores important features in the dataset
options.d: When a model is overly simplified

questions.question: What is the purpose of cross-validation in machine learning?

options.a: To assess the generalizability of a model by using multiple splits of the data
options.b: To increase the size of the dataset
options.d: To clean the data before training

questions.question: What is the purpose of cross-validation in machine learning?

options.a: To assess the generalizability of a model by using multiple splits of the data
options.b: To increase the size of the dataset
options.d: To clean the data before training

questions.question: What is a decision tree in machine learning?

options.a: A tree-like structure used to make decisions based on feature values
options.b: A model for clustering data
options.d: A type of deep learning algorithm

questions.question: What is k-nearest neighbors (KNN) algorithm?

options.a: A classification algorithm based on proximity to neighbors
options.b: A type of neural network
options.d: A clustering algorithm

questions.question: What is a neural network in machine learning?

options.a: A set of algorithms inspired by the human brain, used for classification and regression tasks
options.b: A method for analyzing large datasets
options.d: A technique for dimensionality reduction

questions.question: What is gradient descent in machine learning?

options.a: An optimization algorithm used to minimize the error of the model
options.b: A type of regression analysis
options.d: A method for feature extraction

questions.question: What is the difference between batch gradient descent and stochastic gradient descent?

options.a: Batch gradient descent processes all data at once, stochastic gradient descent processes one data point at a time
options.b: Batch gradient descent is faster, stochastic gradient descent is slower
options.c: Both process data in the same way
options.d: Stochastic gradient descent is used only for classification problems

questions.question: What is the purpose of regularization in machine learning?

options.a: To prevent overfitting by penalizing large weights
options.b: To improve model accuracy
options.c: To clean the data before training
options.d: To speed up the training process

questions.question: What is the confusion matrix?

options.a: A tool for evaluating classification performance by comparing predicted and actual values
options.b: A method for visualizing regression errors
options.d: A type of neural network architecture

questions.question: What is the difference between precision and recall in machine learning?

options.a: Precision is the proportion of true positive predictions out of all positive predictions, recall is the proportion of true positives out of all actual positives
options.b: Precision is the same as recall
options.c: Precision measures the false positives, recall measures the true negatives
options.d: Precision and recall are unrelated metrics

questions.question: What is the curse of dimensionality in machine learning?

options.a: The phenomenon where the model's performance degrades as the number of features increases
options.b: The ability of the model to learn more from high-dimensional data
options.c: The process of adding more data to the training set
options.d: A method for optimizing machine learning models

questions.question: What are convolutional neural networks (CNNs), and where are they used?

options.a: A type of neural network designed for image processing tasks
options.b: A type of neural network for sequential data
options.d: A technique for dimensionality reduction

questions.question: What is a recurrent neural network (RNN)?

options.a: A type of neural network used for sequential data like time series or text
options.b: A type of neural network for image classification
options.d: A data mining technique

questions.question: What is the backpropagation algorithm in neural networks?

options.a: A method for optimizing the weights of a neural network by calculating gradients
options.b: A method for splitting datasets
options.d: A clustering algorithm

questions.question: What is the difference between L1 and L2 regularization in machine learning?

options.a: L1 regularization adds the absolute value of the weights, L2 adds the squared value of the weights
options.b: L1 regularization is used for feature scaling, L2 for classification
options.c: L1 regularization is more effective for large datasets
options.d: L1 and L2 regularization are the same

questions.question: What is the purpose of dropout in neural networks?

options.a: To prevent overfitting by randomly disabling neurons during training
options.b: To speed up the training process
options.d: To scale the data

questions.question: What is reinforcement learning, and how does it differ from supervised and unsupervised learning?

options.a: Reinforcement learning involves agents learning from actions and rewards, while supervised and unsupervised learning involve learning from data
options.b: Reinforcement learning is the same as supervised learning
options.d: Reinforcement learning is a data preprocessing technique

questions.question: What is a support vector machine (SVM), and how does it work?

options.a: A supervised learning algorithm that finds the hyperplane that best separates data into classes
options.b: A type of regression algorithm
options.d: A method for dimensionality reduction

questions.question: What is transfer learning in machine learning?

options.a: Using pre-trained models on new tasks to improve efficiency
options.b: A method of supervised learning
options.d: A way to automate the training process

questions.question: What is the concept of unsupervised deep learning, and how does it differ from supervised learning?

options.a: Unsupervised deep learning uses labeled data to train models, while supervised learning uses unlabeled data
options.b: Unsupervised deep learning learns patterns from unlabeled data, whereas supervised learning learns from labeled data
options.c: Unsupervised deep learning requires manual feature engineering, while supervised learning does not
options.d: Unsupervised deep learning uses a higher number of layers than supervised learning
